reviews.review_msg: I really enjoyed Dr. Northwood's lectures and personality. What I found frustrating was her grading scale. I underestimated the first exam and failed it. Got my act together and did really well on every other exam, however with sub 60% being a fail, 60-70% being a D, 70-80% being a C it was impossible to bring my average up to a B or A.

very test heavy, boring and monotonous and wants memorization. finals was 2 exams, cumulative and the end chapters, what even? very slow so just wants to get over by telling whats on the exam so ots very individual study.

As a non MBB major, Dr. Northwood is the sole reason I took this course. I absolutely love her. She tests on small things but is very clear about exactly what it will be, making a pretty content heavy course manageable. Achieve is optional, the textbook solutions Northwood posts (for free) are the same content if you don't want to pay.

Dr. Northwood is an amazing professor. If you haven't taken one of her classes yet, I highly recommend it. I've had her for both 231 and 321 and if I could take another I would. She's super transparent on what will be on exams and what to prepare for. If you study what she asks you to, it's pretty hard to do poorly in her class.
Awesome professor. Just follow her lectures and practice questions on Achieve.

MBB 321 is a difficult class, and Dr. Northwood's ability to be clear on what will be tested is a godsend in that regard. The concepts are difficult to grasp, but she makes sure that she is very clear on what she needs you to know. Her practice questions on Achieve and the Canvas Lecture quizzes are usually word for word copied as exam questions.

Dr. Northwood's class was a blast! She lets you know EXACTLY what's on the tests; review sessions and tutorials are super helpful. Lecture slides can be a bit dense at times but she does a great job at clearing up concepts. Tests are extremely fair (just follow the slides + tutorials and you're set)

Great lecturer. Makes it EXTREMELY clear what's on the tests (will straight up go through her lecture slides and be like "this is on the test, this isn't, this isn't, oh this is super important, etc, etc." Very pleasant speaker and seems to care about students' success. Always smiley and seems to enjoy her work!
She is probably one of the best profs I have ever had and I would recommend taking any mbb class where she is teaching !!

Lecture Material was quite interesting. However, the learning objectives and exam materials can sometimes be inconsistent. Exams were not bad tho. When asked with certain questions she commonly refers to the textbook. Her review sessions were ok at best although not the most efficient. She is very nice and quite passionate about teaching.

Dr. Northwood is literally the best! She makes MBB as fun as possible despite it being a hard course. Her exams are so easy if you just study her slides and are always so straightforward. No trick questions whatsoever and tells you exactly what she expects. Definitely recommend her for every MBB class!

If Dr. Northwood taught any class, I would seriously be tempted to take it. She is amazing. Her lectures are clear and concise. I have perhaps in my long years at SFU never had a professor who was more clear on what they wanted you to know. She may have many exams, but it is because she wants to make sure you really understand the material

Currently taking my 3rd course with Dr. Northwood. Made it my goal to take as many courses as possible with her. She brightens my spirits every time I enter her class. An MBB degree isn't complete until you've taken a class with this LEGEND. Her selfies with her cat, cat stories (disasters), and cat memes (that she makes herself) are hilarious

Dr. Northwood makes lectures more bearable with her comedic approach to teaching. Never felt like a chore to attend, although she came late a lot. She gives out lots of hints, and the tests are predictable. Not cumulative which is a life-saver. Be diligient and study what she tells you, and I'm fairly sure you'll get at least a B.

Just show up to class to note what she says is on the exam; she gives these hints every lecture and will make you're life easy. Lastly, study the learning outcomes of each lecture and absolutely do the textbook questions and the other questions within her notes because these show up on the exam! I just told you how to get an A. Thank me later.

She's a crystal clear prof. No tricks. She's awesome at explaining things but sometimes I felt like the notes on the slides weren't enough so I would highly recommend not missing lectures. The course became exhausting after awhile because of 5 exams. Also, memorization will only take you so far. Work hard, results will show. .
pretty impressive lectures, study materials are pretty straightforward, you will get a good grade for this class if u have done the assigned questions from her.
Not the best prof for learning the content

Astounding prof! One of my top favorites, she truly exemplifies her passion for her career and the biology of the human body,  everyday, eveyclass. Make sure you take at least one course with her, she only teaches 321 though (she should teach O-chem and all the MBB pre-req's) Go to class!!!

I know people have mixed opinions about Dr. Northwood, but I absolutely LOVE HER. She made MBB 321 a wonderful adventure. She chooses the best TAs for her courses, and is very clear on what to know for exams. All exams were fair and If you attend tutorials, they will boost your mark.

Dr. Northwood was one of my favourite professors in university. She gave great lectures, and there was a lot of back and forth banter with students. We even pranked her with the entire classes' phone alarms. She took it well.  She tells you what to study.  My study group of friends all got A's or A+'s. Half of us are in med school or PhD programs.

Dr. Northwood is hilarious. Lectures are super interesting, though it's hard to absorb the material the first time she goes through it. Lots of textbook questions are re-used on the exam, and she tells you exactly what to focus on at the end of her lectures. Can come across as a bit mean, but is willing to go over important concepts before exams.

Dr. Northwood is a great professor! Her lectures were really interesting, although she is a bit intimidating at first.  Don't skip class because she tells you exactly what is going to be on the test. Also, she puts questions from the textbook and practice exams on the test, which is nice.
Worst teacher ever. I dont even want to talk about this. Shes just terrible. There are hundreds of great teachers out there who would do a better job. She should not be teaching this course.
Shes the toughest grader Ive ever had. Her grading scale is insanely tough. Its tough to pass her course. I wish I never had to take it.
I thought Dr. Northwood was okay but not a very nice prof by any means. very unapproachable and extremely moody. If possible, I would avoid her course in the future.
one of the worst prof I've ever had. avoid her course if possible.

I went into this class absolutely hating MBB. I came out of this class absolutely loving it, that's how great Dr. Northwood is. She is by far my favourite prof so far in University. Her lectures are extremely interesting and the best part of all-she tells you EXACTLY what is going to be on the exams. Honestly, how can you not succeed? I got an A+!

Our final was on the last day of class. Her lectures are fast but she gets the point across. She tells you whats on the exam, and the exams overall were somewhat fair, just watch out for tricky questions. Make sure you do the given book questions and the learning objectives at the end of each lecture. Her grading scale is very harsh.

I have no clue how she is still allowed to teach. She doesn't know how to teach and i think that is reflected in the horrible class averages for all three midterms. Just make sure to do the assigned questions and her objectives at the end of each lecture.

this prof should be sent to where the sun dont shine, we give her card and prank and the students get stabbed in the back.  i wish i had taken this course with davidson now. her grading was totally unfair and scale was even worse... 80% is a B+/B... are u kidding me? We didnt even have enough time to study for finals. just utterly horrible period.

She is definitely a GREAT prof. You can't possibly fall asleep in her class for she goes through thirty or so slides in one class hour, but  this doesn't mean her lectures are too much. She covers important materials thoroghly and she even tells us what will be on the test. She is fair. I would strongly recommend her.

This woman is brilliant in her field of work. Her lectures make that very obvious. Having said that, she's also incredibly disrespectful and condescending to some students. Whether you fall on her good or bad side is arbitrary.

LOVE HER! one of the best teachers I have ever had. Yes she can be rude and she ain't no walk in the park but shes soooooo good at teaching. You could listen to her for hours and she makes it super clear! Would love to take another class with her!
Make sure you do recommended problems and practice questions for the exam. Also attend lectures because she tells you what topics are important for the exam.
expects waaaaayyy tooo much from her students and when u ask her for help or study advice she is very very rude!

I thought she was scary after she yelled at our class for bombing the 1st midterm (it was hard!), but when I went to her office hours she was *so* nice that I completely changed my mind. She is a little scatterbrained sometimes, but seriously...teaching and being the mbb undergrad academic advisor is a lot of work.

very moody, kinda scary sometimes! she tells you what will be on the exam during lecture since the level of material is very high! i personally dont like her wording on exams; i find it confusing. remember, with her " you will get whatever you will get!" dont rely too much on the curve. above 86%-->A.
No Comments

OMG!!! She's ok for 322 but she is HECTIC for 321 (on top of the already super-heavy-and-sheer-load of material killer class) Goes over 30 something slides a lecture, non-stop! She can't even breathe herself. Hard exam that screwed a lot of people over (as opposed to the high average in mbb322)Don't have time to get down anything she says!
She is bad only if you are stupid
Can't really get some help from her regarding the course material. she usually not avaliable for extra help.

Dr. Northwood is excellent in terms of teaching, clarity, attitude, personality, etc.  As for going to her during non-office hours, would you want a few hundred MBB undergrads popping by whenever they felt like it?

Very clear on what you need to know and what you don't, tests memorization and context at the same time.  As long as you go IN office hours she is really nice (but will bite you if you are not in office hours) Overall great teacher

scatter brain.  she cant maintain a clear line of thinking.  she formates her course so that you memorise certain details but never really learn anything.  for learning she is terrible, for getting an easy B she's ok.

her focus is not to teach principles of metabolism but to teach you to memorize a rediculous amount of detail.  if you like to memorize she is for you but if you actually want to learn something at universty then forget it.
Dr. Northwood rules!!  Makes metabolism about as interesting as it can be made.  If she says it's on the exam, it is, and if she says it's not, then it's not.  The tests can be a bit long, though.
She gives good notes, but the exams are not fair
REALLY NICE!!!
She talks so fast - it drives me crazy!  But she is apparently the best in the department for MBB teachers!
Great teaching, tough exam
